text: Near the Chapultepec Forest lived a long time ago a man who became rich and famous raising Crows for the best zoos in the country and the world and which turned out so excellent that after a few generations and with the force of good will and perseverance they no longer tried to take their eyes off their breeder but instead specialized in plucking them out to the mirons who without fail and giving samples of the worst taste repeated before them the vulgarity that they did not have to raise Crows because they took one's eyes off. The Black Sheep and Other Fables
title: Los Cuervos bien criados
author: Augusto Monterroso
